public class zeta.content.zirp.UnitEnv

(source file: UnitEnv.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.Term
           |
           +----zeta.content.zirp.UnitEnv
The pure class interface. 
public class UnitEnv
  extends Term
The class of unit environments.

A unit environment gives information about macros, fixities, and global names defined in a ZIRP unit.

Unit environments may be queried using the session system.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: UnitEnv.pizza,v 1.10 2000/02/10 10:20:34 wg Exp $
See also:
ZirpContentTypes, query

newSection
public static UnitEnv newSection(Name unitName,
                                 Locator locator);
Construct a new empty environment for the named unit representing a Z section.

newClass

public static UnitEnv newClass(Name unitName,
                               Locator locator,
                               Name[] formals);
Construct a new empty environment for the named unit representing a mSZ class.

copy

public UnitEnv copy();
Make a shallow copy of the given environment, including any annotations of information records.

importSyntaxFrom

public void importSyntaxFrom(UnitEnv parent);
Import the syntactic information of the given environment into this environment. This method includes all macros and fixities of the given environment in this environment.

importConstantsFrom

public void importConstantsFrom(UnitEnv parent);
Import the context information of the given environment into this environment. This includes all constants of the given environment in this environment.

forgetOrigins

public void forgetOrigins(Name[] origins);
Forget the import origin of the named parent units. All objects with origin of the named units will receive the origin of the unit of this environment, as if they have been declared in it. The named units will be removed from the parent list.

declareMacro

public void declareMacro(Locator locator,
                         Name name,
                         int argc,
                         Lexem[] subs);
Enter a macro declaration. Warnings are produced if the macro overrides an older definition.

declareFixity

public void declareFixity(Locator locator,
                          Fixity fixity);
Enter a fixity declaration. Warnings will be produced if the fixities redefines keyword assignments.

declareConstant

public void declareConstant(Locator locator,
                            Name name,
                            Name[] generics,
                            Expr type);
Enter a constant declaration. Errors will be produced if the name overwrites an older declaration with an incompatible type or genericity.

getLexemInfo

public LexemInfo getLexemInfo(Lexem lexem);
Give information about a lexem. Returns null if no special information induced by fixities is present.

public static class PragmaInfo
public static class PragmaInfo
  extends AnnotatedTerm
Information record for a pragma declaration. May carry an annotation.

public static class MacroInfo

public static class MacroInfo
  extends AnnotatedTerm
Information record for a macro declaration. May carry an annotation.

public static class FixityInfo

public static class FixityInfo
  extends AnnotatedTerm
Information record for a fixity declaration. May carry an annotation.

public static class ConstantInfo

public static class ConstantInfo
  extends AnnotatedTerm
Information record for a constant declaration. May carry an annotation. In particular, for mSZ schemas with role a DeclAttr is attached.

See also:
DeclAttr

public static class LexemInfo

public static class LexemInfo
Information about a lexem.

Parameters:
rewritten - the rewritten value
leftOffside - whether this lexem puts line-separators at the left offside
rightOffside - whether this lexem puts line-separators at the right offside
